list_definition.definition: something that gives one enjoyment; joy or delight

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I get a lot of pleasure from listening to music.

list_ex_of_english: Besides the pleasure and pride derived from parades, conference sessions gave delegates the opportunity to share ideas and to further linkages between communities.
These networks are paths to employment, peer assessment and fan pleasure all at the same time in ways that seem impossible to untangle.
This is why we watch other people suffering with pleasure.
They are more often about social interaction, physical pleasure, affirming faith, fulfilling roles and expressing culture.
So the men do not get real pleasure out of life, and in the end they meet a fearful death.
It is purely agricultural; agricultural in its produce, agricultural in its poor, and agricultural in its pleasures.
It is a pleasure to thank him for his encouragement and under standing.
The father expressed feelings of pleasure in seeing his wife relax and his children enjoying participating in the music.
